detaileddescription.para: Warnings that could likely be ignored.
Defines the available levels (severity/priority) of logging output.
Use the default for this type of destination.
Do not include time stamps in output.
Do not include the human-readable logging level in output.
Do not include the process/app name in output.

Don't include milliseconds in time stamps. If not set, time stamps in output to this destination will be appended with the current millisecond in addition to the hour, minute, and second. If SIRO_NOTIME is set, this has no effect.
Don't write header messages when logging begins, or the file is rolled. Only applicable to log files.
Includes all other options; effectively disables all output formatting except the original formatted message (does not include SIRO_NOHDR; set that flag in addition to remove header messages).
If set, the foreground color is 'intensified'.
Available styles (colors, brightness) for console output.
Used to differentiate between a single sir_level and one or more bitwise OR'd together.
Used to differentiate between a single sir_option and one or more bitwise OR'd together.
The underlying type used for characters in output.
The value used to represent an invalid file identifier.
The value that represents the success condition.
Any thread may initialize SIR, but any calls to other library functions will fail until this call has completed.

parameterdescription.para: Initialization options.
SIR is initialized and ready to use.
Initialization failed.

briefdescription.para: Frees allocated resources and resets internal state.

detaileddescription.para: It is not necessary to call this function from the same thread that called sir_init. Any calls made after this to functions other than to sir_init (in order to re-initialize) will fail.

simplesect.para: Mutexes allocated during initialization are not destroyed during cleanup; they are retained for potential further re-initialization.

parameterdescription.para: SIR is cleaned up.
An error occurred.

detaileddescription.para: This function maps internally to the logging level SIRL_DEBUG.

parameterdescription.para: A printf-style format string.
(variadic) Additional arguments whose types correspond to the format specifier at the same index in format.
All destinations registered for this level were successfully processed.
One or more destinations were not successfully processed.

One or more destinations were not successfully processed.

briefdescription.para: Add a log file to receive formatted output for one or more sir_level.

parameterdescription.para: The absolute or relative path to the file. If it does not exist, it will be created.
One or more sir_level for which the file should be sent output. Use SIRL_ALL to send all logging levels to the file.
Zero or more sir_option flags used to control output formatting.
The file descriptor for the file that was successfully added.
An error occurred while trying to add the file.

briefdescription.para: Remove a previously added log file.

parameterdescription.para: The integer file descriptor returned from sir_addfile.
The file was removed and will no longer receive output.
An error occurred while trying to remove the file.

briefdescription.para: Sets the text style in stdio output for a sir_level of output.

parameterdescription.para: The level (only one is permitted per call) for which the style will be set.
Foreground color, background color, and brightness control flags bitwise OR'd to create the text style for level. See sir_textstyle.
The style is valid and was applied.
An error occurred while trying to set the text style.

detaileddescription.para: Functions and types that comprise the public interface to the library.
